metadata.titel_preek: The Song Of Moses And The Song Of The Lamb

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the historical context of the Exodus and the apocalyptic vision of Revelation, weaving in contemporary social-political commentary on race and politics.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Narrative-driven; focuses on the 'struggle' motif rather than technical word studies. Strong on biblical theology of deliverance.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from historical narration (Assertive) to urgent exhortation (Directive) and finally to eschatological assurance (Commissive).
voorbeelden: I want to talk with you a little while
The Lord requires that we use whatever we've got

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To instill hope in the midst of social struggle and to move the hearer to commit their small talents to God's large cause.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher speaks of God 'going into action' but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's role in the hearing.

voorbeelden: Evil does not give up easily.
The church has marched for twenty centuries.
General Motors is now a junior partner.
Let me have charge of your life.
I respect anybody who is older than I am.
He will pick us up when we're down now.
He will strengthen us when we are weak now.
Every valley will be lifted up.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High; the 'Now!' section functions as a powerful series of promises binding God to the hearer's present.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; the preacher quotes Christ's declaration rather than pronouncing a direct absolution to the congregation.

indicatoren: Long sections on General Motors and Toyota
Extended anecdotes about music theory and Max Roach
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives much information and social analysis, which may delay the 'event' of the encounter.

missende_elementen: Sacramental 'I' in the name of God
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is a spectator of God's work in history until the final third of the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly rhythmic and repetitive, creating a 'litany of promise'.
voorbeelden: He will answer us when we pray now. Now!

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and homiletical 'I want to talk'.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct appeal to 'you' in the application of the staff/talent.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Egypt, the Jews, the political right, and the Lamb.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only bridged in the final climax.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about evil and music.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the history of Exodus (Assertive) to the promise of God's action (Commissive) to the call to use the staff (Directive).
voorbeelden: God went into action... He will pick us up... Use that!
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition from the 'indicative' of the Cross to the 'imperative' of service is well-handled.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The power is not in the staff anyhow; it's in Moses's willingness to commit... God went into action.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to provide hope through the 'Toezegging' (Promise) of God's future and present victory.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He will pick us up when we're down now; he will straighten us out when we're wrong now.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of immediate divine availability.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: General Motors, our biggest automobile maker, is now a junior partner of the Japanese maker Toyota.
zwakke_punten.problem: Theological focus is diluted by economic/political lecture.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the 'Now!' of the Gospel breaks through the historical and political analysis.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strong on the 'Word as Promise', but slightly weak on the 'Word as Act' (Declarative).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit; the preacher speaks for God's character.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly felt in the 'Use that!' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: God asks that that which you have be thrown in on his side.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher relies on the 'power of the music' and the 'power of the story' to move the heart.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, especially in the 'Song of the Lamb' section where the Cross is presented as the definitive settlement.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High in the description of Calvary.
tekstueel_bewijs: The old account is settled. It has all been straightened out.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense narration and sociological description. It needs more present-tense performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, I declare to you: you are delivered now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth (Assertive) to a specific event (Declarative).

voorbeeldzinnen: God promises you today that your struggle is not in vain.
You are standing at your own Red Sea tonight.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The foundation of 'It is finished' is a perfect indicative for the imperative 'Use what you've got'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of narrative preaching that successfully transitions into performative promise, despite a heavy load of social commentary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his age; SAT focuses on the 'Commissive' force of the Gospel promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'music' metaphor; SAT asks if the 'music' actually performs the deliverance it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the shift from 'talking about' the ghetto to 'declaring' the victory of the Lamb.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it changes the status of the hearer from debtor to free.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses music as a locutionary bridge to the illocutionary force of the 'Song'.
